mdRecord.dcterms:title: Tincture of iodine
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: C. A. Mosso Company [manufacturer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Contained in cardboard box; label information: Mult-A-Ply Iodine, 10 C.C. Size, 3 per unit, E.D. Bullard Co., 275 Eighth St, San Francisco; directions on back of box; 3 glass vials of iodine, 2 contained in cardboard sleeves - label information: Mild Tincture of Iodine U.S.P., Prepared by C.A. Mosso Company, Chicago, Illinois for E.D. Bullard Co., San Francisco, Cal.; gives antidote; WWII era, possibly 8th evac donation.
Photographed by Claude Moore Health Sciences Library, Historical Collections and Services staff.
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The University of Virginia Medical Artifacts Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Antiseptics
